tenses:
Used to talk about what you DID.
Take the infinitive, delete its ending (-ar, -er, -ir) and add these endings:

The preterite has many irregular verbs:
 such as 'ser' (fui), 'ir' (fui), 'querer' (quise), 'hacer' (hice), 'estar' (estuve), 'tener' (tuve), 'poder' (pude), 'jugar' (jugué), etc.

Used to talk about what you USED TO DO or WERE DOING.
Take the infinitive, delete its ending (-ar, -er, -ir) and add these endings:
cantar (to sing) → cantaba = I used to sing
beber (to drink) → bebías = you used to drink
vivir (to live) → vivían = they used to live

The imperfect has only 3 irregular verbs:
'ir' (iba), 'ser' (era) and 'ver' (veía).

Used to talk about what you HAVE DONE.
Take the correct form of the verb 'haber' (see column).
Then look at the infinitive:
If it ends in -ar, delete it and add -ado.
If it ends in -er or -ir, delete that ending and add -ido.
hablar (to talk) → he hablado = I have talked
correr (to run) → hemos corrido = we have run
compartir (to share) → habéis compartido = you all have shared

Some irregulars include:
'hacer' (he hecho), 'escribir' (he escrito) and 'ver' (he visto)

Used to talk about what you NORMALLY DO.
Take the infinitive, delete its ending (-ar, -er, -ir) and add these endings:
vivir (to live) → vivís = you all live

Used to talk about what you ARE DOING.
Take the correct form of 'estar' (see column) and add the gerund.
You form the gerund by taking the infinitive and deleting its ending.
If the ending was -ar add -ando.
If the ending was -er or -ir add -iendo
bailar (to dance) → estoy bailando = I'm dancing
beber (to drink) → está bebiendo = he/she is drinking
compartir (to share) → estamos compartiendo = we are sharing

There are very few irregulars in this tense:
Examples: 'ir' (estoy yendo), 'decir' (estoy diciendo)

Used to talk about what you ARE GOING TO DO.
Take the correct form of the verb 'ir' (see column) + the word 'a' + the infinitive
cantar (to sing) → voy a cantar = I'm going to sing
aprender (to learn) → vas a aprender = you are going to learn
vivir (to live) → vamos a vivir = we are going to live
There are no irregular verbs in this tense!

Used to talk about what you WILL DO.
Take the infinitive, DO NOT DELETE ITS ENDING (-ar, -er, -ir) and add these endings:
hablar (to talk) → hablaré = I will talk
correr (to run) → correrás = you will run
decidir (to decide) → decidirán = they will decide

A few verbs change the root but keep the same endings.
Some examples are 'querer' (querré), 'hacer' (haré), 'tener' (tendré) or 'poder' (podré)

Used to talk about what you WOULD DO.
Take the infinitive, DO NOT DELETE ITS ENDING (-ar, -er, -ir) and add these endings:
cantar (to sing) → cantaría = I would sing
beber (to drink) → bebería = he/she would drink
compartir (to share) → compartirían = they would share

A few verbs change the root but keep the same endings.
Some examples are 'querer' (querría), 'hacer' (haría), 'tener' (tendría) or 'poder' (podría)
